snippet: Unicef and the World Health Organization said they would seek to vaccinate four million children, but it was unclear whether Islamist militants would agree.
abstract: Unicef and World Health Organization, increasingly worried about possible spread of polio amid Iraq's escalating chaos, say they have begun mass vaccination in what amounts to test case of whether Islamist extremists will allow such an effort in areas they control.
lead_paragraph: Unicef and the World Health Organization said they would seek to vaccinate four million children, but it was unclear whether Islamist militants would agree.

headline.main: Amid Iraq’s Political Chaos, a New Polio Vaccination Campaign Faces Challenges
headline.print_headline: Amid Iraq’s Political Chaos, a New Polio Vaccination Campaign Faces Challenges

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
